DocumentType.summary: The DocumentType interface represents a containing a doctype.

remarks.para:
-The DOM interfaces index.
- to create a new DocumentType node.

DocumentTypeAfter.summary:
The DocumentType.after() method inserts a set of
objects or strings in the children list of the
DocumentType's parent, just after the DocumentType.
Strings are inserted as equivalent nodes.

DocumentTypeBefore.summary:
The DocumentType.before() method inserts a set of
objects or strings in the children list of the
DocumentType's parent, just before the DocumentType.
Strings are inserted as equivalent nodes.

DocumentTypeName.summary: The read-only name property of the returns the type of the document.

remarks.para: For synthetic DocumentType, this property reflects the value given in parameter to .
For HTML documents, browsers always set it up to html, whatever the actual doctype in the source code is.

DocumentTypePublicId.summary: The read-only publicId property of the returns a formal identifier of the document.

remarks.para: For synthetic DocumentType, this property reflects the value given in parameter to .

DocumentTypeRemove.summary:
The DocumentType.remove() method removes a document's doctype.
If it is already detached from the document, calling remove() does nothing.

DocumentTypeReplaceWith.summary: The DocumentType.replaceWith() method replaces the document type with a set of given nodes.

DocumentTypeSystemId.summary: The read-only systemId property of the returns the URL of the associated DTD.

remarks.para: For synthetic DocumentType, this property reflects the value given in parameter to .
